apiList.worksheet.charts: Returns a collection of charts that are part of the worksheet.
apiList.chart.categoryLabelLevel: Specifies a chart category label level enumeration constant, referring to the level of the source category labels.
apiList.chart.chartType: Specifies the type of the chart. See Excel.ChartType for details.
apiList.chart.dataLabels: Represents the data labels on the chart.
apiList.chart.displayBlanksAs: Specifies the way that blank cells are plotted on a chart.
apiList.chart.format: Encapsulates the format properties for the chart area.
apiList.chart.height: Specifies the height, in points, of the chart object.
apiList.chart.left: The distance, in points, from the left side of the chart to the worksheet origin.
apiList.chart.legend: Represents the legend for the chart.
apiList.chart.name: Specifies the name of a chart object.
apiList.chart.pivotOptions: Encapsulates the options for a pivot chart.
apiList.chart.plotArea: Represents the plot area for the chart.
apiList.chart.plotBy: Specifies the way columns or rows are used as data series on the chart.
apiList.chart.plotVisibleOnly: True if only visible cells are plotted. False if both visible and hidden cells are plotted.
apiList.chart.series: Represents either a single series or collection of series in the chart.
apiList.chart.seriesNameLevel: Specifies a chart series name level enumeration constant, referring to the level of the source series names.
apiList.chart.showAllFieldButtons: Specifies whether to display all field buttons on a PivotChart.
apiList.chart.showDataLabelsOverMaximum: Specifies whether to show the data labels when the value is greater than the maximum value on the value axis.
apiList.chart.style: Specifies the chart style for the chart.
apiList.chart.title: Represents the title of the specified chart, including the text, visibility, position, and formatting of the title.
apiList.chart.top: Specifies the distance, in points, from the top edge of the object to the top of row 1 (on a worksheet) or the top of the chart area (on a chart).
apiList.chart.width: Specifies the width, in points, of the chart object.
apiList.chart.worksheet: The worksheet containing the current chart.
apiList.chart.activate(): Activates the chart in the Excel UI.
apiList.chart.getDataTable(): Gets the data table on the chart.
apiList.chart.getDataTableOrNullObject(): Gets the data table on the chart, returning an object if the chart doesn't allow a data table.
apiList.chart.getImage(width, height, fittingMod: Renders the chart as a base64-encoded image.
apiList.chart.load(options): Queues up a command to load specified properties of the object.
apiList.chart.set(properties, options): Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time.
apiList.chart.setData(sourceData, seriesBy): Resets the source data for the chart.
apiList.chart.setPosition(startCell, endCell): Positions the chart relative to cells on the worksheet.

apiList.workbook.worksheets: Represents a collection of worksheets associated with the workbook.
apiList.worksheets.getActiveWorksheet(): Gets the currently active worksheet in the workbook.
apiList.worksheet.charts: Returns a collection of charts that are part of the worksheet.
apiList.chatCollection.count: Returns the number of charts in the worksheet.
apiList.chatCollection.items: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.
apiList.chatCollection.getCount(): Returns the number of charts in the worksheet.
apiList.chatCollection.getItem: Gets a chart using its name. If there are multiple charts with the same name, the first one will be returned.
apiList.chatCollection.getItemAt(index): Gets a chart based on its position in the collection.
apiList.chatCollection.getItemOrNullObject(name): Gets a chart using its name; returns an object with isNullObject true if the chart doesn't exist.
apiList.chatCollection.load(options): Queues up a command to load specified properties of the object. Requires context.sync() before reading properties.
